description: New Latin colius, probably from Ancient Greek κολιός (koliós, “a kind of woodpecker”).

entries.meaning: Any bird of either of the genera Colius or Urocolius, endemic to sub-Saharan Africa.
examples: Coliiformes is the only order of birds endemic to Africa. Six species from two genera (Urocolius and Colius) are recognized, all of which are sedentary. Mousebirds (also known as colies) range through sub-Saharan open savannas and are often common in such areas.
